content:
19. The prophet regularly addressed as ‘son of man’ was 
A. Jeremiah B. Ezekiel 
C. Isaiah D. Amos E. Hosea. 
 
20. What was the last miracle God performed before the 
Israelites were released from Egypt? 
A. Thick darkness brought about by the hot wind 
‘Khamisin’. 
B. The pollution of the Nile. 
C. The slaughter of all the male children. 
D. The plague of locusts. 
E. The slaughter of the first born. 
 
21. Who was the prophet who proved on Mount Carmel 
that Yahweh is greater than Baal? 
A. Elijah B. Elisha 
C. Nathan D. Hosea 
E. Amos. 
 
22. On the third day of creation God made 
A. light. B. the firmament. 
C. the earth.  D.    animals. E. man. 
 
23. The Lord said to Moses: Cut two tablets of stone like 
the first; and I will write upon the tablets the words that 
were upon the first tablets which you broke. On what 
occasion was this said? 
A. At the renewal of the Covenant. 
B. During the election of Aaron. 
C. Just before the election of Joshua. 
D. After the first fall of Manna from heaven. 
E. Shortly before the conquest of Jericho. 
 
24. The city of Jericho was captured by the Israelites 
A. after a fierce battle lasting seven days. 
B. because the army of the city was betrayed by 
some of its soldiers. 
C. because the defence system was very weak. 
D. at the blast of the trumpets of the  priests. 
E. because famine had broken out in the city and 
the inhabitants surrendered because of 
hunger. 
 
25. The call of Isaiah took place 
A. on the return from the Babaylonian captivity. 
B. in the year of the death of King Uzziah. 
C. during the dedication of the temple by king 
Solomon. 
D. shortly before the rise of the Maccabees. 
E. after David had completely defeated the 
Philistines. 
 
26. When Zechariah doubted the announcement of the 
birth of John he 
A. fell down and fainted. 
B. was struck dumb. 
C. rebuked the angel Gabriel. 
D. knelt down and prayed. 
E. told his wife about it. 
 
27. Herod wanted to kill the child Jesus because 
A. he thought he would became a prophet. 
B. he learnt that he was born king of the Jews. 
C. the wise men worshipped Jesus. 
D. he was born of a virgin. 
E. he was born in a manger. 
28. What is the main lesson of the parable of the prodigal 
son? 
A. Parents must not be partial. 
B. A son should always obey his father. 
C. God forgives those who sincerely repent. 
D. One should not be wasteful. 
E. Brothers should love each other. 
 
29. ‘These men who have turned the world upside down have 
come here also, and Jason has received them. Which town 
is referred to here? 
A. Tarsus B. Ephesus 
C. Corinth D. Thessalonica E. Athens. 
 
30. ‘And you, child, will be called the prophet of the Most 
High’, refers to 
A. Samuel.  B. Jesus. C. Jeremiah. 
D. John the Baptist. E. Moses. 
 
31. The parable of the mustard seed teaches that 
A. the kingdom of God is invisible. 
B. although the kingdom of God is for all, very 
few enter it. 
C. the kingdom of God will expand world-wide 
from what appears to be an insignificant 
beginning. 
D. It is not certain when the kingdom of God will 
come. 
E. The kingdom of God is within us. 
 
32. When the women got to the tomb of Jesus they found 
the stone rolled away and 
A. saw Jesus coming out of the tomb. 
B. Jesus was no longer in the tomb. 
C. Jesus was sitting in the tomb. 
D. immediately saw a vision of Jesus. 
E. saw an angel singing hallelujah. 
 
33. ‘You shall be my witnesses in Jerusalem and in all Judea 
and ... and to the end of the earth. 
A. Rome. B.    Antioch. C. Damascus. 
D. Samaria E. Israel. 
 
34. Paul was first arrested in Jerusalem because he 
A. brought Greeks into the temple. 
B. became a Christian. 
C. preached Christ in the temple. 
D. spoke against the temple. 
E. preached against circumcision. 
 
35. Which country in Africa provided Jesus with a refuge 
when Herod sought to destroy him? 
A. Algeria.  B.   Egypt. C. Morocco. 
D. Ethiopia. E. Libya. 
 
36. ‘After me comes he who is mightier than I, the thong of 
whose sandals I am not worthy to stoop down and 
untie’. Who said this? 
A. Jesus Christ. B. Mary Magdalene. 
C. Mark D. John the Baptist 
E. The annuciation angel. 
 
37. Who addressed Jesus at Jericho, saying, ‘Jesus, son 
of David, have mercy on me?’ 
A. Bartimaeus the blind beggar. 
B. Simon the leper. 
C. Simon of Cyrene.
